channel.title: AdventCalendar2019 on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in AdventCalendar2019 on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Uncle SE whose brain was hardened studied machine learning
item.description: ## [Introduction] This article will be on the 19th day of How I learned machine learning by Nikkei xTECH Business AI ② Advent Calendar 2019. Here is how my uncle SE studied machine learning. The motivation was to start with the question, “Can you use machine learning?” Since I was working in the dark clouds, my honest memory is vague. career I have been programming for nearly 30 years. Starting with MS BASIC I learned when I was in elementary school, I have touched Z80 assembler, MC68000 assembler, FORTRAN, C (UNIX), C++ (Mac), VB, Java (Android), VB.

item.title: [Python] Overview of class-based generic view and inherited class relationship
item.description: This article is from the 13th day of Django Advent Calendar 2019. In this article, I would like to summarize Django’s “Class-based Generic View” and its inheritance class relationships. Premise I refer to and cite the official documentation of Django 3.0, which is the latest version at the time of writing this article. What is a Class-Based Generic View? First, a “view” in Django is an encapsulation [^1] of logic that processes user requests and returns responses.

item.title: [Python] Machine learning Machine learning learned by a new graduate who has no experience in machine learning
item.description: This article is about how I learned machine learning by Nikkei xTECH Business AI② Advent Calendar 2019 __. Let’s talk about the steps that have taken a slightly different step from the general approach to learning machine learning. I would be happy if it could be used as a reference for as many people as possible. I usually write for individual blogs, and I was warmly thinking about writing on my blog, but I thought it was a great opportunity, so I posted it on __qiita for the first time __.
